intro: Belosynapsis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower bellflower, is a rare and specialized plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of a single, showy bell-shaped flower per stem. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color, and they bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Belosynapsis uniflora is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
